question: Luigi Mangione, the suspected shooter of UnitedHealthcare CEO in Manhattan, was arrested at a McDonald's in this state. He was found in the city of Altoona after being identified by a civilian. This state is home to the highest point in the eastern United States east of the Mississippi River, Mount Davis, which peaks at 3,213 feet above sea level. The Susquehanna River, the longest river on the American East Coast, flows through the state, providing a vital waterway for transportation and recreation. Name this "Keystone State" that is bordered by New York, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, West Virginia, and Ohio.

A federal judge blocked a merger between Albertsons and this grocery chain. Albertsons then pulled out of the deal and sued this grocer. The company, the largest supermarket chain in the United States by revenue, operates over 2,700 stores in 35 states. It is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, and its history traces back to 1883 when Barney Kroger invested his life savings to open a grocery store in downtown Cincinnati. What is the name of this supermarket giant, known for its customer loyalty programs and its "Our Brands" product line?

Time Magazine recently named this man their "Person of the Year". This man made history this year by being the first person since Grover Cleveland to win non-consecutive presidential elections. Name this real estate developer turned politician who is known for this Mar-a-Lago club in Florida.

At age 18, Gukesh Dommaraju recently became the youngest world champion of this game. This game, whose earliest predecessor is believed to be chaturanga, which originated in India before the 6th century CE, features pieces with names derived from Persian words, such as "shah" for king and "rukh" for chariot.  The longest recorded game, "The Evergreen Game" played in 1852, lasted 20 hours and 15 minutes and ended in a draw after 147 moves.  Its modern form evolved in Europe during the 15th century, with standardized rules and the introduction of the powerful queen piece. Name this strategic board game.

This man recently fled to Moscow after rebels took control of the Damascus, Syria. His father was the president of Syria from 1971-2000. This man then took his father's office in 2000 and served in the role until he was forced to flee by rebel forces. Name this son of Hafez al-Assad who has been accused of war crimes during the Syrian Civil War.

Christopher Wray announced he would step down as the leader of this agency at the beginning of 2025. This agency's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list, established in 1950, has featured notorious criminals like Osama bin Laden and Ted Bundy. Its headquarters, the J. Edgar Hoover Building in Washington, D.C., is named after its first director, who led the agency for 48 years. It is responsible for investigating federal crimes, including terrorism, cybercrime, and organized crime. What is the name of this federal law enforcement agency?

This artist recently complete her record-breaking "Eras Tour" which kicked off in March 2024. The tour featured a setlist spanning her entire music catalog, from her country beginnings to her pop anthems. The tour's elaborate stage design, costume changes, and surprise acoustic songs have delighted fans and critics alike. It has become the highest-grossing tour of all time by a female artist, surpassing Madonna's "Sticky & Sweet Tour." The tour's opening night in Glendale, Arizona, led the city to temporarily rename itself "Swift City" in honor of the event. Who is this singer-songwriter?
